image.altText: A portrait of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi Beach shooting

props.synopsis: Albanese has announced sweeping reforms to crack down on antisemitism in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

title.children: PM announces reforms to combat 'evil scourge'

image.altText: Images of English cricketer Harold Larwood.

props.synopsis: Flying fruit pips are less menacing than the cork and leather cricket balls that Harold Larwood hurled at Australian batsmen during the infamous Bodyline series, but a showdown between the English fast bowler and a disgruntled crowd that was allegedly armed with pomegranate seeds is part of the rich story of Ashes acrimony.

title.children: A Bodyline bowler was pipped by pomegranates, and an uproar ensued

image.altText: GettyImages-2252349499

props.synopsis: The Strikers consign the Sixers to 0-2 despite Daniel Hughes taking a one-handed ripper late in the match.

title.children: Strikers win in final over thriller as Sixers star takes classic catch

image.altText: A screen grab of Snicko showing a big spike with the ball not close to the bat.

props.synopsis: Snicko's boss admits an operator error dudded England out of the wicket of Alex Carey on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

title.children: England fumes as Snicko operator admits using wrong stump mic

image.altText: A police car blocking off a street, one row of house opposite a row of trees

props.synopsis: Two people have been charged with murder after a 62-year-old man was shot dead near South Australia's wine region of McLaren Vale on Wednesday evening.

title.children: Two people charged with murder after man shot at McLaren Flat

image.altText: A screen shot of a Tamika talking to the camera, long blonde hair, flowers in the hair, low-cut dress, crystal chandelier.

props.synopsis: Police are still waiting to examine a large volume of evidence, including a a post-mortem report in the "complex" alleged murder case involving Tamika Chesser, a court has heard.

title.children: Former Beauty and the Geek contestant's murder case adjourned

image.altText: Alex Carey looks upwards while holding his bat and helmet after making a century

props.synopsis: Alex Carey looked to the heavens as his name rang out from the Adelaide Oval stands, his emotional century saving Australia's day one and furthering his push to one day stand among the great wicketkeeper-bats.

title.children: Carey king of Adelaide for a day as emotional century saves Australia

image.altText: Two sea lion pups with one draped over the other

props.synopsis: Australia's sea lion population has had a tough winter with rising pup mortalities amid the algal bloom, but dedicated researchers are doing everything they can to help their survival as a species.

title.children: Hope for Australia's sea lions amid more pup deaths

image.altText: A man in a shirt with Aboriginal art on it looks above the camera.

props.synopsis: Malyangapa Baaka Wiimpatja artist Leroy Johnson says the axing of an arts grant, which he is the last recipient of, has left the Broken Hill arts community feeling unsupported.

title.children: 'Not OK': Oldest regional art gallery in New South Wales left in lurch

image.altText: A woman kneels next to a massive washed up ray on a sandy beach with another few dead rays behind her.

props.synopsis: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

title.children: Deaths of rays and sharks blamed on algal bloom

image.altText: A police officer holds a gun while standing at the gates of the Adelaide Oval during the third Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police will be carrying rifles and exercising additional weapon and drug search powers at Adelaide Oval during the Third Ashes Test, following the Bondi terror attack on Sunday.

title.children: Police presence increased at Adelaide Oval Ashes Test in wake of Bondi shooting

image.altText: A large white truck with SES decals and a boat trailer behind in a car park

props.synopsis: A 67-year-old Victorian man has been found dead, and a 74-year-old Victorian man is still missing in waters off Cape Jaffa after they failed to return from fishing.

title.children: Search for missing experienced fisher after companion's body found

image.altText: A man wearing a dark suit and shirt is sitting and looking directly at the camera. Behind him is a board room table and chairs

props.synopsis: After 13 years serving as South Australia's top judge, Chief Justice Chris Kourakis says it is "an appropriate time to retire".

title.children: SA's top judge Chris Kourakis retires

image.altText: Merry Christmas Christmas lights on a house.

props.synopsis: With the push of a smartphone button, those watching Luke Denton's Christmas light display in Blackwood can add their own splashes of colour, or even turn the whole thing off.

title.children: Interactive Christmas lights giving children the 'power' from Adelaide foothills

image.altText: A group of cricket fans watch on during sunset

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg opens up on the future of day-night Tests in the future summer schedule.

title.children: Cricket Australia reveals future of day-night Tests

image.altText: A older man in a pageboy's cap and suit stands behind microphones and next to two people in suits

props.synopsis: A Holocaust survivor says the Bondi terror attack should be "a wake-up call" for the nation as the South Australian government double its funding for education programs.

title.children: SA government doubles Holocaust education funding after Bondi attack

image.altText: A generic image of soccer balls inside a net.

props.synopsis: An outbreak of the flu has delayed an upcoming A-League Women's match between Adelaide United and Melbourne City, as South Australia grapples with a record number of cases.

title.children: A-League Women's match postponed due to flu outbreak

image.altText: Four small children sit inside the inner rim of the wheel of large piece of yellow farm machinery.

props.synopsis: A group dedicated to Australian grain farming created more than a decade ago has just cracked 100,000 followers with about 20,000 people following from overseas.

title.children: Farmers flock to online group to connect during the highs and lows

image.altText: A white car, behind a police tape, a blue tent is set up behind.

props.synopsis: Barkindji mother-of-two Sonya Dutton, 31, was found in her family's Wilcannia residence on March 29, 2022 — four days after she was reportedly last seen.

title.children: 'Unanswered questions' despite inquest into mum found dead in backyard

image.altText: A graphic showing newspaper headlines

props.synopsis: Silvagni employed a legal team exclusively to fight for a suppression order, preventing his name from being reported by the media for more than a year.

title.children: How Tom Silvagni kept his name out of headlines before rape conviction

image.altText: A woman sitting at a desk with a laptop.

props.synopsis: Most people spent time doing unpaid work in 2024, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It found women spent on average an hour more doing unpaid work than men.

title.children: These charts show how Australians are spending their time

image.altText: Albanese holds up a Medicare card.

props.synopsis: Labor has two options when it comes to straddling a budget in the red and accusations it has become a green Grinch on health funding.

title.children: Party allegiance counts for little when there's $121 billion worth of problems

image.altText: An image of a boat parked on a suburban street, with parts of the boat blurred.

props.synopsis: Lake Macquarie man Jake Dearie has been refused bail after being charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on his boat.

title.children: Man denied bail for 'blatant' alleged display of Nazi symbols on boat

image.altText: A man in a black suit looks into the camera as he reads from a sheet.

props.synopsis: Charles James Spencer-Churchill, 70, who is known as Jamie Blandford, is the 12th Duke of Marlborough, one of Britain's most senior aristocratic families.

title.children: UK's Duke of Marlborough charged with intentional strangulation

image.altText: Logos of Paramount, Netflix and Warner Bros brought together in one illustration.

props.synopsis: In a letter to shareholders, the board wrote that Paramount had "consistently misled" Warner Bros shareholders that its $US30-per-share cash offer was fully guaranteed, or "backstopped," by the Ellison family,

title.children: Warner Bros rejects rival $163bn bid from Paramount

image.altText: An empty and dirty glass mineral water bottle held up in a forest.

props.synopsis: Searchers find a water bottle and a garbage bag that may have been used as a poncho in the Tasmanian bushland where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer went missing.

title.children: 'Potential shelter' found in bushland search for Celine Cremer

image.altText: Tim Tszyu throws a punch against Anthony Velazquez

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu has dominated against unbeaten American Anthony Velazquez, winning by unanimous decision at the Sydney Entertainment Centre.

title.children: Tim Tszyu comfortably wins on blood-soaked return to the ring

image.altText: An office building, with a sign that reads 'ACT Government'.

props.synopsis: A legislative inquiry has criticised the ACT government for aggressively recovering debts from people it found were ineligible for stamp duty concessions.

title.children: Home buyers hit by harsh debt pursuit, inquiry finds

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks on the phone.

props.synopsis: When Trump was elected president in 2016, he joined the world's most exclusive and revered club. But three years later, the president added his name to a smaller list of US leaders who'd been impeached.

title.children: The day Donald Trump joined the ranks of impeached US presidents

image.altText: A close-up side-on shot of Marlion Pickett with his head slightly bowed.

props.synopsis: Dual Richmond premiership player Marlion Pickett receives a suspended prison term for possessing and dealing with proceeds of crime, in what a judge calls a "line-ball decision".

title.children: Ex-AFL star Marlion Pickett sentenced in 'line-ball decision'

image.altText: close up of child's foot playing with soccer ball on the grass

props.synopsis: Many parents are aware posting photos of their children online comes with risk. But it's not only images that can be harmful for your child.

title.children: The details we share about our kids online that are riskier than photos

image.altText: Exterior of the fitzroy community school - a brick building painted with a mural of rolling fields with a sunset

props.synopsis: The school that inspired author John Marsden is facing potential legal action from parents over allegations of physical abuse.

title.children: Parents threaten legal action over abuse allegations at 'cult-like' school

image.altText: A man walking through the Fushimi Inari Shrine in Kyoto, Japan

props.synopsis: Your task in the ABC Places quiz is to correctly identify the location shown in each of 10 photos. Grab your passport and let's go.

title.children: ABC Places quiz: Find your way around the world

image.altText: A teenage girl smiling front of a sunset

props.synopsis: Annabelle Klint-Pedersen was celebrating the end of year 12 with friends on the Sunshine Coast when an innocent trip to watch the sunset went tragically wrong.

title.children: Father pays tribute to 'loving' teenage daughter after lookout death

image.altText: A woman with short stands in front of the base of a large spotted gum looking friendly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Thought to be 500 years old, a 70-metre-tall spotted gum is almost hidden in the middle of a South Coast state forest. Conservationists want the "world champion" tree and the forest it lives in recognised and celebrated.

title.children: Push to recognise home of 70-metre-tall 'world champion' spotted gum
